metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: CSS Flex Items
The CSS Flex Items
The direct child elements of a flex container automatically becomes flex items.
content.html: The direct child elements of a flex container automatically becomes flex items.

content.text: The element above represents four blue flex items inside a grey flex container.
content.html: The element above represents four blue flex items inside a grey flex container.

content.code_html:
<div class="flex-container">
  <div>1</div>
  <div>2</div>
  <div>3</div>
  <div>4</div>
</div>

content.text: The CSS properties we use for flex items are:
content.html: The CSS properties we use for flex items are:

content.text: The order Property
The order property specifies the order of the flex items inside the flex container.
content.html: The order property specifies the order of the flex items inside the flex container.

content.text: The first flex item in the code does not have to appear as the first item in the layout.
content.html: The first flex item in the code does not have to appear as the first item in the layout.

content.text: The order value must be a number, default value is 0.
content.html: The order value must be a number, default value is 0.

content.code_html:
<div class="flex-container">
  <div style="order: 3">1</div>
  <div style="order: 2">2</div>
  <div style="order: 4">3</div>
  <div style="order: 1">4</div>
</div>

content.text: The flex-grow Property
The flex-grow property specifies how much a flex item will grow relative to the rest of the flex items.
content.html: The flex-grow property specifies how much a flex item will grow relative to the rest of the flex items.

content.text: The value must be a number, default value is 0.
content.html: The value must be a number, default value is 0.

content.code_html:
<div class="flex-container">
  <div style="flex-grow: 1">1</div>
  <div style="flex-grow: 1">2</div>
  <div style="flex-grow: 8">3</div>
</div>

content.text: The flex-shrink Property
The flex-shrink property specifies how much a flex item will shrink relative to the rest of the flex items.
content.html: The flex-shrink property specifies how much a flex item will shrink relative to the rest of the flex items.

content.text: The value must be a number, default value is 1.
content.html: The value must be a number, default value is 1.

content.code_html:
<div class="flex-container">
  <div>1</div>
  <div>2</div>
  <div style="flex-shrink: 0">3</div>
  <div>4</div>
  <div>5</div>
  <div>6</div>
  <div>7</div>
  <div>8</div>
  <div>9</div>
  <div>10</div>
</div>

content.text: The flex-basis Property
The flex-basis property specifies the initial length of a flex item.
content.html: The flex-basis property specifies the initial length of a flex item.

content.code_html:
<div class="flex-container">
  <div>1</div>
  <div>2</div>
  <div style="flex-basis: 200px">3</div>
  <div>4</div>
</div>

content.text: The flex Property
The flex property is a shorthand property for the flex-grow , flex-shrink , and flex-basis properties.
content.html: The flex property is a shorthand property for the flex-grow, flex-shrink, and flex-basis properties.

content.code_html:
<div class="flex-container">
  <div>1</div>
  <div>2</div>
  <div style="flex: 0 0 200px">3</div>
  <div>4</div>
</div>

content.text: The align-self Property
The align-self property specifies the alignment for the selected item inside the flexible container.
content.html: The align-self property specifies the alignment for the selected item inside the flexible container.

content.text: The align-self property overrides the default alignment set by the container's align-items property.
content.html: The align-self property overrides the default alignment set by the container's align-items property.

content.text: In these examples we use a 200 pixels high container, to better demonstrate the align-self property:
content.html: In these examples we use a 200 pixels high container, to better demonstrate the align-self property:

content.code_html:
<div class="flex-container">
  <div>1</div>
  <div>2</div>
  <div style="align-self: center">3</div>
  <div>4</div>
</div>

<div class="flex-container">
  <div>1</div>
  <div style="align-self: flex-start">2</div>
  <div style="align-self: flex-end">3</div>
  <div>4</div>
</div>

content.question: Exercise?What is this?Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page

content.text: The CSS Flex Items Properties
The following table lists all the CSS Flex Items properties:
content.html: The following table lists all the CSS Flex Items properties:

content.code_html:
Property Description
align-self Specifies the alignment for a flex item (overrides the flex container's align-items property)
flex A shorthand property for the flex-grow, flex-shrink, and the flex-basis properties
flex-basis Specifies the initial length of a flex item
flex-grow Specifies how much a flex item will grow relative to the rest of the flex items inside the container
flex-shrink Specifies how much a flex item will shrink relative to the rest of the flex items inside the container
order Specifies the order of the flex items inside the container
